DOC.brief_summary: Prediction of Low Birth Weight Infants using Ultrasound Measurement of Placental Diameter and Thickness
DOC.brief_title: Prediction of Low Birth Weight Infants Using Ultrasound Measurement of Placental Diameter and Thickness
DOC.detailed_description: The aim of the present study is to assess the value of using ultrasound measurement of placental diameter and thickness as a predictor of low birthweight.
DOC.criteria: 1. Singleton viable pregnancy. 2. Gestational age at least 36 complete weeks as calculated by LMP. 3. Non scared uterus. 1. Multiple fetal pregnancy. 2. Intrauterine fetal death. 3. Known congenital fetal anomalies. 4. Presence of uterine or adnexal gross pathology. 5. Presence of any medical disorder e.g. Diabetes mellitus & hypertension.
